Letter From The Editor
BITS Task System
Starbreak Sector: Maps
Starbreak Sector: UWPs
Starbreak Starships: Ownership
Starbreak Starships: Classes
Starbreak Naval Philosophy
Ground Forces of Starbreak
Starbreaker Attitudes, 1500 Imperial

103901.name: Auto Auction
103901.description: One player is the car auctioneer. S/he reveals the car and the features of the car (i.e. air conditioning, power windows etc.) and opens the bidding. Players are dealt eight bidders cards with values ranging from 25 to 10000 dollars. The bidders select a combination of cards to create their bid. The player that is closest to the reserve price, which is only known to the auctioneer, wins the round.

103902.name: Tiffany Star (Issue 23)
rpgpublisher: History of the Imperium Working Group
103902.description:
From the credits:

Tiffany Star is a monthly amateur periodical published in support of the History of the Imperium Working Group (HIWG).

103904.name: Tiffany Star (Issue 24)
rpgissuearticle: MegaTraveller Referee's Exchange: Worlds, Art, Other Stuff
Will Traveller Survive to the Year 2000?
rpgpublisher: History of the Imperium Working Group
103904.description:
From the credits:

Tiffany Star is a monthly amateur periodical published in support of the History of the Imperium Working Group (HIWG).

103905.name: Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Blue Rescue Team and Red Rescue Team
103905.description:
Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Blue Rescue Team (ポケモン不思議のダンジョン 青の救助隊 Pokemon Fushigi no Danjon Ao no Kyūjotai?) and Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Red Rescue Team (ポケモン不思議のダンジョン 赤の救助隊 Pokemon Fushigi no Danjon Aka no Kyūjotai?) are a matched pair of Pokémon games for the Nintendo DS and Game Boy Advance, respectively. These two games were developed by Chunsoft and were published by Nintendo.

The two versions are mostly identical, with the Blue version taking advantage of the dual-screen features and increased graphical capabilities of the Nintendo DS. The game has six Pokémon exclusive to each version. As of July 25, 2007, Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Blue Rescue Team sold 3.08 million copies worldwide.

The player starts out as a human who turned into a Pokémon, which can be one of sixteen Pokémon(Bulbasaur, Squirtle, Charmander, Cyndaquil, Totodile, Chikorita, Treecko, Torchic, Mudkip, Pikachu, Eevee, Machop, Cubone, Psyduck, Meowth, and Skitty) and is determined by a personality quiz taken at the beginning of the game. The player chooses a partner Pokémon which is one of ten Pokémon (which excludes the last six stated above and the Pokémon of the same type). The game is mission-based with many jobs, which can be found on the bulletin board, requested by mail, or initiated through story events, and include rescuing Pokémon, delivering items, or escorting clients. If the player successfully completes a job, they receive a reward, and Rescue Points, which increase a team's rank.

These jobs take part in dungeons, of which the layout is randomized.[1] The objective is to either finish a job, or go through all the floors to find the exit. In the dungeon, there are wild Pokémon that battle with the player's team. These battles are turn-based, and take place in the dungeon map. Pokémon fight using the four moves they know, by using a standard 'A button' attack, or throwing rocks and other items. While going through the dungeon, the player gets hungry, and has to eat food either found in the dungeon, or bought in advance.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Blue Rescue Team and Red Rescue Team", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

103906.name: Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time and Explorers of Darkness
videogamehonor: 2008 Japan Game Awards Game of the Year Winner
2009 D.I.C.E. Role-Playing Game of the Year Nominee
103906.description:
Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time (ポケモン不思議のダンジョン 時の探検隊 Pokémon Fushigi no Danjon Toki no Tankentai?, lit. "Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Time Exploration Team") and Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Darkness (ポケモン不思議のダンジョン 闇の探検隊 Pokémon Fushigi no Danjon Yami no Tankentai?, lit. "Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Darkness Exploration Team") are a matched pair of Pokémon games for the Nintendo DS. The two games were released in Japan on September 13, 2007, and were released in North America on April 20, 2008. They were released in Europe on July 4, 2008.

A sequel to Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Blue Rescue Team, new features include the addition of Generation IV Pokémon, improved Wi-Fi functionality, and more touch-screen options. 491 of the 493 Pokémon are featured, as Shaymin and Arceus were not officially released at the time of the game's launch.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time and Explorers of Darkness", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

103907.name: The Time of Troubles 1605-1612
103907.description:
The game is about a crucial point in the history of Russia. The Time of Troubles (Smuta) at the beginning of the 17th century. After the mysterious death of the Great Prince Dmitry, son of Ivan the Terrible, begins the political and military struggles depicted in this game.

2-5 players each represent a faction in the struggle for the throne of the Tsar.

Military and Political Strategy Game that is played through movement of units on a location based map connected by a road net. Victory points are acquired for the control of cities and fortresses, battles won and placing a Tsar on the throne. Leaders are used both in battle with military units as well as to gain control of the cities and forts. Other Characters are used as well to manipulate political events. Card play is used to influence the course of the game. Military units are recruited or purchased during play.

103908.description:
The Errant Paladin is a special promotional character that adds a fourth ability to the Paladin from the base game.

The Errant Paladin wields a Broadsword of Might, which defeats all minions at a location when doubles are rolled in combat.
103908.name: Defenders of the Realm: The Errant Paladin
boardgameexpansion: Defenders of the Realm

103909.name: Finders, Keepers?
103909.description:
Publisher Blurb

Jack is being teased by the fifth-grade bully on the school bus. Readers help Jack decide whether to ignore him, ask an adult for help, or fight back.

103910.name: Bully on the Bus
103910.description:
Publisher Blurb

Jack is being teased by the fifth-grade bully on the school bus. Readers help Jack decide whether to ignore him, ask an adult for help, or fight back.

103911.name: Making the Grade
103911.description:
Publisher Blurb

Jenny puts more energy into soccer than into her grades. When she gets a poor report card, she has to decide whether to tell her parents, cheat on a test, or get help from the teacher.

103912.name: First Day Blues
103912.description:
Publisher Blurb

Megan’s first day at a new school in a new town has made her very nervous. How can she get over the jitters and make new friends?

103913.name: Under Whose Influence?
103913.description:
Publisher Blurb

Jamie goes home with some friends to work on a school project together. Her friends decide to sample their parents’ liquor cabinet, and they want Jamie to join them. What should Jamie do?

103914.name: Red Baron Mission Builder
103914.description:
From back of the box

Red Baron now gets a major feature upgrade, including a mission builder, new planes and more of the legendary aces.

FEATURES:

- Mission Builder: Experience the challenge of creating your own custom missions with an easy-to-use, point and click interface.

- Pick your favorite type of mission: dogfighting, hunting Zeppelins, escorting bombers, defending balloons and more.

- Choose to fly at different times of day in all types of weather. From clear to stormy; you control the amount of daylight and cloudcover.

- Select the type of plane you want to fly, and whether to fly individually or as part of a group or formation.

- Handpick your opponents, from novice pilots to veteran aces.

- Edit mission conditions to test your fighting skills.

- New planes: Take to the skies in all new aircraft including the Fokket D.VIII, Halberstadt D.II, Nieuport 28, Nieuport 11 Bebe and the Siemens Schuckert D.III.

- New aces: Test your skill against new WWI aces including Captain D.M. MacLaren, William George Barker, Karl Degelow, Roderic Stanley Dallas and R. von Schleich.

103916.name: Tiffany Star (Issue 25)
rpgissuearticle: Will Traveller Survive to the Year 2000?
rpgpublisher: History of the Imperium Working Group
103916.description:
From the credits:

Tiffany Star is a monthly amateur periodical published in support of the History of the Imperium Working Group (HIWG).

103919.name: Tiffany Star (Issue 26)
rpgpublisher: History of the Imperium Working Group
103919.description:
From the credits:

Tiffany Star is a monthly amateur periodical published in support of the History of the Imperium Working Group (HIWG).

103920.name: Tiffany Star (Issue 27)
rpgissuearticle: Tonnage vs Cost for All MegaTraveller Starships
rpgpublisher: History of the Imperium Working Group
103920.description:
From the credits:

Tiffany Star is a monthly amateur periodical published in support of the History of the Imperium Working Group (HIWG).

103921.name: My Body
103921.description:
Tagline: 5 games to show what you're made of

The 5 "games" are:
1. Puzzle for one child: Assemble a human body
2. Lotto: Puzzle pieces are picked out one by one. First player to name the part and place the piece gets a point. Highest points wins.
3. Dominoes: Assemble a human body puzzle, starting with a corner. The next piece used must connect to a piece already in place. First player to place their pieces wins.
4. How well do you know your body: Puzzle pieces are picked out one by one. Players place a counter on the location where they think the piece go. Only one counter can be placed in a location. The player with the right answer gets a point, highest points win.
5. Anatomy: One player reads a word card relating to an area of the body (i.e. kidney, upper jaw). The other players find the area just read on one of four figures. Players place a counter on the location where they think the piece go. Only one counter can be placed in a location. The player with the right answer gets a point, highest points win.

103922.name: Star Wars: Angriff der Rebellen
boardgameversion: German third edition (featuring Star Wars: Rebels)
103922.description:
In Star Wars: Angriff der Rebellen, the crucial battle against the Empire is about to begin, and countless space battles await you. Can you face off against a TIE Fighter, a Star Destroyer, or even the Death Star itself?

During this mission you'll encounter many allies, such as Luke Skywalker, Han Solo or Yoda, who can aide you in exciting dice duels. Whoever can defeat the strongest Imperial spaceships at the end of the game wins.

103923.name: Was ist Was: Junior – Feuerwehr
103923.description: In Was ist Was - Junior: Feuerwehr, players are confronted with fire-fighting situations and asked which tool would be best. What's most important at a fire: a crane, a pump, or a cutter? What about when attending an automobile accident? The answers are on back of the challenge cards, and the game includes an information booklet about fire departments.

103924.name: Was ist Was: Junior – Mein erstes Quiz
103924.description: Was ist Was - Junior: Mein erstes Quiz indeed qualifies as a first quiz game for the younger audience. Pirates, knights, dinosaurs, horses – these are the topics on which the players will be challenged, with a picture on each of the hundred cards showing a task along with three images of possible solutions. Can the players identify the correct solution? Will they advance to Mein zweite Quiz?

103925.name: Kinect
103925.description:
Kinect for Xbox 360, or simply Kinect (originally known by the code name Project Natal), is a motion sensing input device by Microsoft for the Xbox 360 video game console. Based around a webcam-style add-on peripheral for the Xbox 360 console, it enables users to control and interact with the Xbox 360 without the need to touch a game controller, through a natural user interface using gestures and spoken commands. The project is aimed at broadening the Xbox 360's audience beyond its typical gamer base. Kinect competes with the Wii Remote Plus and PlayStation Move with PlayStation Eye motion controllers for the Wii and PlayStation 3 home consoles, respectively.

Kinect was launched in North America on November 4, 2010, in Europe on November 10, 2010, in Australia, New Zealand and Singapore on November 18, 2010, and in Japan on November 20, 2010. Purchase options for the sensor peripheral include a bundle with the game Kinect Adventures and console bundles with either a 4 GB or 250 GB Xbox 360 console and Kinect Adventures.
After selling a total of 8 million units in its first 60 days, the Kinect holds the Guinness World Record of being the "fastest selling consumer electronics device". 10 million units of the Kinect sensor have been shipped as of March 9, 2011.

Microsoft has released of a non-commercial Kinect software development kit for Windows on June 16, 2011, with a commercial version following at a later date. This SDK will allow .Net developers to write Kinecting apps in C++/CLI, C#), or Visual Basic .NET.

Source: Wikipedia, "Kinect", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

103926.name: Was ist Was: Junior – Piraten
103926.description:
Was ist Was - Junior: Piraten challenges players to find where the green parrot is hiding or spot the pirate with an eye patch. (There's only one?)

The players search for many hidden objects, then simultaneously guess where they think the object is located by choosing and revealing a tip card. Players who are correct advance their ship toward the finish line. First one across the line is a scurvy dog!

103927.name: The Game of Games
boardgameversion: C.W. Faulkner "Can You Solve?" Party Game Series
103927.description:
Party game where guests are given a personal question sheet on arrival and advised to answer the questions during the evening.
In this game, the 'questions' relate to the name of 24 games which are named by the cryptic clue.
For example;
Q. What is twice five
A. Tennis (Ten is)

103928.name: Hong Kong Special Administrative Region
103928.description:
From Introduction:

TECHNOLOGY
Past investments allow SAR citizens free access to unparallelled Interface bandwidth, at least when the power’s on: live Immatrix broadcasts are the latest luxury, allowing the audience to feel actors’ every sensation in real time. 24/7 celebrity gossip feeds, bootlegs of L.A.’s latest, manhua webcomics, and mahjong gambling “schools” are welcome distractions from the squalor of life underground. Of necessity, the region is a hotbed of innovation for wearable air filtration gear.

ENVIRONMENT
Hong Kong’s “fragrant harbor” is a fetid mess; seasonal typhoons and pollution from mainland factories fuse into month-long acidic downpours, forcing the masses into warrens extending hundreds of meters into the bedrock. Only The Clean can afford the augmentations that keep unfiltered time outdoors non-lethal; everyone else makes do with coated raingear and filter-masks. When the Air Pollution Index dips low enough, the streets erupt in impromptu festival; there hasn’t been a safe day in years.

SOCIETY
On the surface, the city is thriving. But triad and corporate corruption of government officials has enmeshed the city in debt, and left it unable to maintain its infrastructure, negotiate with the mainland, enforce the law, or compete as a port. Periodic power outages turn the slums into a claustrophobic hell for hours at a time, with air filtration and temperature control limping along via jury-rigged batteries.

This Transmission was released as bonus to backers of the Technoir Kickstarter.

103929.name: Il gioco della Melevisione
103929.description:
A game about an Italian TV-series, the Melevisione. The main characters have lost their favourite objects and the players must help them to find back three, randomly chosen at the start of the game. The children roll and move on the board and visit some locations, each hiding 2 items (face-down tokens). When coming to a location, they may secretly look at those object tokens.
Some tiles have special powers, such as swapping places to tokens, getting free moves and so on.
Whenever a player thinks they know where each object is, they walk back to the starting place and show the locations of the three items. If they are right, they win. If not, they are out of the game.

103930.name: Zhodani
103930.description:
From the back cover:

Viewed with fear by other races, the Zhodani are believed to harbour powerful psionics within a terrible and oppressive society. Alien Module 4: Zhodani peels back the layers of mystery and mis-information to reveal a fascinating race who are a domineering force in their region of the galaxy.

This book is packed with information for both players and referees. New rules for careers allow players to create their Zhodani characters, which are then well served by technology and ships designed by and for the Zhodani. Chapters are devoted to playing a Zhodani and how their society and culture are structured, complete with how they handle psionics. Finally, we have also included a complete new sector to explore, meshing seamlessly with the Spinward Marches.

103931.name: WiF the Computer Game
103931.description:
While waiting (for the Matrix Games version) and to whet your appetite we have available Australian Design Group's original version of this international award winning game. The original Chris Marinacci version has been our greatest project ever, started in 1995 and only finished in 2002. This version forms the basis of the Matrix version of World in Flames (although admittedly the Matrix version has some mighty souped up graphics and enhancements)and includes:

All of World War II on a grand strategic scale
1-8 players playing 1 or more of the 8 major powers of WWII (China, the Commonwealth, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the Soviet Union and the USA)and their ever obedient minor countries
playable hotseat or solitaire (requires player to play both sides, unfortunately there is no artificial intelligence in the Marinacci edition)
Now you can have the destiny of the world in your hands.

Operating Systems supported

The program runs under Windows 95, Windows 98, Windows Me, Windows 2000, Windows XP, and Windows NT 4.0.

Hardware requirements:

5 MB disk space
64 MB RAM
Pentium CPU or better
Video card capable of at least 800x600 resolution
Scenarios Implemented

Barbarossa
Guadalcanal
World in Flames

Source: The Publisher Website.

103934.name: Pathways (Issue 6 - Aug 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Review: Dim Spirit: Curse of the Golden Spear Part 2
Review: Faces of the Tarnished Souk: Brynhild Eirensdottir, the Shining Valkyrie
103934.description: New templates, equipment, and interviews with Ben Mcfarland and Emily Kubisz.

103935.description:
Isle of Wight is a 2 player print-and-play map for Steam. The map incorporates a sixth goods colour (black) and ferry links that can be built in the same way as track tiles. The availability of goods cubes is very tight.

From the introduction:
The Isle of Wight, off the south coast of England, was popularised as a holiday destination by Queen Victoria, who regularly spent summers at Osborne House, near East Cowes. In order to handle the increasing numbers of visitors, the first railways on the island, between Cowes and Newport, and between Ryde and Shanklin, opened in the 1860s. By the turn of the century there were 55 miles of track on an island that measures little more than 20 miles by 12.
103935.name: Steam Expansion: Isle of Wight
boardgameexpansion: Steam

103936.name: Steel Storm: Burning Retribution
103936.description:
User Summary

Steel Storm: Burning Retribution is a top-down, free-roaming sci-fi shooter. You pilot a hovercraft, and accomplish mission objectives. The hovercraft can be repaired and upgraded by items you can find along the way. Enemy units get progressively more challenging to contend with, as they start using cover to combat you more effectively.

The game features single-player and networked multi-player play modes.

103937.description:
If I'm Going Down... (or IIGD) is the first ever Dying Card Game (or DCG) from Van Ryder Games. A DCG is a card game in which it is certain that the character(s) WILL die. For 1 to 2 players (expandable to 3 to 4 with a 2nd copy), IIGD is set in a world overrun by zombies. Unlike virtually every other Zombie game, your goal is not to survive, but to kill as many zombies as possible before you die, which results in very engrossing solo or cooperative play.

IIGD puts you smack in the middle of a hopeless scenario where endless zombies lurch and ramble toward you, never stopping until you are dead or become one of them (Zead). You must gather and use weapons and resources to take as many of the abominations as you can with you.

Zombies enter the playing area from several "Entry" points depending on the scenario. You can take actions during your turn such as Attack, Use an Item, or Search for Resources. Each turn the Zombies will be moved closer and closer and eventually the resources will run out...

Random events or "Occurrences" that come into play and change the rules keep the game fresh and different every time. The game may be played in a sort of "Kill em All" mode where you simply try to achieve the best score or you can play one of several Story Arcs that add entertaining story lines to the game where how well you do determines what happens in the story after you die.

The unique mechanisms of the Fate Deck – which determines whether you find a resource when searching and whether you "hit" or "miss" during an attack – and the Tracker cards – which are used to keep track of health, ammo, and inventory – make this a game unlike any you have seen before.

One other thing that makes this game unique in the Zombie genre is that each Zombie is illustrated with AMAZING detail and has a character all its own. You may just become more invested in the story of the Zombies than you are in the characters you play!

IIGD allows for some level of creative control for players who have interest in making their own layouts and scenarios.
103937.name: If I'm Going Down...
boardgameexpansion: If I'm Going Down...: Penelope Character Card
If I'm Going Down: Taking Back the Town Promo Cards
boardgameaccessory: If I'm Going Down Custom Game Mat
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 032 - If I’m Going Down…
Episode 83-- Live from GEN CON Part 2-- from the show floor
Exploring Games, Episode 15: Exploring Solitude
OBG 069: Suck on My Big Deck Building Game
OBG 90:Decisions, Decisions, Oh Pay Me

103938.name: Sabre Wulf (GBA)
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
103938.description:
User Summary
Once again Sabreman is called upon to adventure for the good of all mankind. Traveling through a world ripe with allusions to classic Ultimate Play the Game titles, Sabreman must use friendly animal companions to transverse many dangerous landscapes and take back what the Sabrewulf has stolen from the villagers.

103939.name: Badges & Bullets
103939.description:
Badges & Bullets is a cooperative game set in the old west. Players will take turns protecting the town's bank from pesky outlaws and preparing for inevitable jail breaks. The game is won once all outlaws are successfully routed, and the day is lost when the towns funds have all been robbed or all the deputies are dust in the wind.

To help them in their goal, they can visit town locations such as the saloon, mines, train station, etc. Each location offers different tactics in dealing with these desparadoes.

Players will also have a choice of which role they want to fill in the town, such as the sharpshooter, the preacher, the town drunk, or even the sheriff himself.

The town needs your help but you're gonna need quick wits and an even quicker trigger finger to save the day.

103940.name: Super Fire ProWrestling Special
103940.description:
User Summary

Super Fire ProWrestling Special is the sixth Fire Pro Wrestling game released for the Super Famicom.

This title in the popular Japanese pro wrestling video game line featured a large number of wrestlers and fighters from the following organizations: New Japan ProWrestling, All Japan ProWrestling, Wrestle Association R, Frontier Martial-Arts Wrestling, Michinoku ProWrestling, Bukoh Dojo, ProWrestling Fujiwara Gumi, Fighting Network RINGS, Union of Wrestling Forces International, Hybrid Wrestling Pancrase, Universal Wrestling Federation, Japanese Wrestling Alliance, International Wrestling Association Japan, Ultimate Fighting Championship, K-1 Grand Prix.

In addition to the starting organizations, there are two hidden organizations HIDE (hidden wrestlers) and KAKU (hidden shootfighters). These are unlocked after defeating the Champion Road mode.

103941.name: Wrestling Universe: Fire Pro Joshi – Doumu Chou Taisen
103941.description:
User Summary

Wrestling Universe: Fire Pro Joshi - Doumu Chou Taisen is the fourth game in the Fire Pro Wrestling series of Japanese professional wrestling video games released for the PC Engine/TurboGrafx-16 console.

This title was released for the TurboGrafx CD-Rom attachment. It also required the use of the 2MB RAM expansion known as the Arcade Card.

The game features wrestlers from the All Japan Women's ProWrestling and Japan Women's ProWrestling organizations.

103942.name: Super Fire ProWrestling: Queen's Special
103942.description:
User Summary

Super Fire ProWrestling: Queen's Special is the seventh game in the long running Fire Pro Wrestling series of Japanese professional wrestling video games released for the Super Famicom.

The game features an all female roster, as the name implies.

103943.name: Chronicles of the Void Beta Rules
103943.description:
From Introduction:

Chronicles of the Void (CotV) is a Pen&Paper RPG set in an original space opera universe. Each player will create their own iconic hero and decide their fate as they collect elite equipment and customize themselves by earning experience which will be distributed in an intricate nexus of abilities that are completely unique for each of our iconic character templates.

The game is built on the foundation of an innovative game engine which defines two major systems for handling fast paced action: the One Breath Combat (OBC) and Vehicle Assault and Pursuit (VAP) systems. The OBC system engages players in skirmishes which encourage cinematic actions and the speedy resolution of events to keeps players in the moment and prevents the lag of complex sequential actions. The VAP system captures the excitement of piloting your own customizable star fighter into battle simulating 3D combat on a 2D grid. CotV trims the fat off of the tabletop gaming experience and cuts straight to the action with a strong emphasis on ease of play and unlimited extensibility through the cyber realms of the Neuro Labyrinth. The Neuro Labyrinth allows each player's iconic character to create avatars to roam the vast cyberscape opening up new frontiers in customization and depth on a level which is previously unimagined.

103945.name: Super Fire ProWrestling X
103945.description:
User Summary

Super Fire ProWrestling X was the eighth and final Fire Pro Wrestling game released for the Super Famicom. A second version of the game, with fifty additional edit slots, was released one year later with the title: Super Fire ProWrestling X Premium.

The game features wrestlers from the following organizations: New Japan ProWrestling, All Japan ProWrestling, Frontier Martial-Arts Wrestling, International Wrestling Association, Wrestle Association R, Michinoku Pro, Heisei Ishingun, WWF, WCW, Union of Wrestling Forces International, Fighting Network RINGS, ProWrestling Fujiwara Gumi, and Legendary Wrestlers. Freelance wrestlers, Pancrase competitors, and MMA fighters are also included.

103946.name: Fire ProWrestling for WonderSwan
103946.description:
User Summary

Fire ProWrestling for WonderSwan is the only title in the Fire Pro Wrestling series of games released for that console.

The game features wrestlers from the following organizations: New Japan ProWrestling, All Japan ProWrestling, Frontier Martial-Arts Wrestling, Michinoku ProWrestling, WCW, WWF, Fighting Network RINGS, Battlarts, and Toryumon. Players can also select from Pancrase fighters, MMA fighters, and some freelance wrestlers.

boardgamehonor: 2011 Charles S. Roberts Best Desktop Published (DTP) / Print-and-Play / Postcard Game Nominee
103947.description: This huge historical module for Advanced Squad Leader covers the Siege of Cholm. German troops were surrounded by Soviets and held out waiting on supplies and reinforcements. This module contains 15 scenarios, 2 campaign games, 2 summer maps, 2 winter maps, 1 countersheet with 213 total counters, player aid cards, and a historical booklet.
103947.name: Kampfgruppe Scherer: the Shield of Cholm
boardgameexpansion: Advanced Squad Leader
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 94: No Place Like Cholm

103948.name: Front Mission 2
103948.description:
User Summary

Front Mission 2 is a Tactical RPG that is a part of the main Front Mission series. The missions proceed on a linear path, after each mission you are able to equip and customize your Wanzers, the series version of Mechs. Throughout the game control switches between three groups of characters.

The game has not been released outside of Japan.

103950.name: 007: Tomorrow Never Dies
videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
103950.description:
Tomorrow Never Dies (also known as 007: Tomorrow Never Dies) is a third-person shooter based on the James Bond film of the same name. Developed by Black Ops and published by Electronic Arts, it was released on November 16, 1999 exclusively for the Sony PlayStation. It is the first 007 game of many that was published by Electronic Arts since acquiring the James Bond licence. This game marks the fourth appearance of Pierce Brosnan's James Bond, although the voice of Bond is provided by actor Adam Blackwood in the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tomorrow Never Dies (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

103951.name: Forced Alliance
103951.description:
User Summary

A space combat sim featuring a character driven plot and three alien races. Your actions taken in battle or during conversation can effect how future missions play out or change the direction of the games story.

103952.name: Trade & Battle: Card Hero
103952.description:
Trade & Battle: Card Hero (トレード&バトル カードヒーロー Toreedo & Batoru Kaado Hiiroo?) is a card battle RPG developed by Nintendo R&D1 and Intelligent Systems and published by Nintendo for the Nintendo Game Boy Color. It was released only in Japan on February 21, 2000. It seems that Trade & Battle: Card Hero was intended to be released in America, but it was canceled for unknown reasons (going to www.card-hero.com redirects you to Nintendo of America's home page).

In this game, the player plays as Hiro, a blue-haired boy living in a town where the game Card Hero has become very popular. He wishes to become a master of the game by collecting different kinds of cards. He also wishes to duel various opponents, including his rival, Masaru Kado. His goal becomes harder to achieve when several bad guys cause trouble in town.

Source: Wikipedia, "Trade & Battle: Card Hero", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

103953.name: Peter Pan: A Story Painting Adventure
103953.description:
User Summary

Take control of Peter Pan in this children's adventure game. Yse different drawing supplies to get you through challenges in different humorous ways. Watch the story play out between each challenge.

103954.name: Fire Pro Wrestling 2
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
103954.description:
User Summary

Final Fire ProWrestling: Yume no Dantai Unei! (or Fire Pro Wrestling 2 for English speakers) was the second and last Fire Pro Wrestling video game to get a release on the Game Boy Advance.

BAM! made some roster changes in the US version of the game: Sixty-five Japanese wrestlers were replaced with a handful of American wrestlers. They also added more edit slots to the game.

The wrestlers available in this version are from the following organizations: New Japan ProWrestling, All Japan ProWrestling, Pro-Wrestling NOAH, Zero One, Frontier Martial-Arts Wrestling, Michinoku Pro-Wrestling, Toryumon, World Wrestling Federation, World Championship Wrestling, Asistencia Asesoria y Administracion, and Fighting Network RINGS. There are also Pancrase fighters, Pride fighters, Freelance wrestlers, Legendary wrestlers, and a couple of other promotions.

103955.name: Comic Jumper: The Adventures of Captain Smiley
103955.description:
User Summary

Take control of Captain Smiley , a "superhero", and his sidekick Star. The duo is having problems creating a successful comic series. After finding your comic canceled due to poor sales, the only way to gain popularity for a new series is to jump into other comics as a guest character. Every comic will see the Captain using different weapons and dressed in a way to match the world. The game plays like a side scrolling shooter.

103956.name: Deadliest Warrior: Legends
103956.description:
User Summary

Deadliest Warrior Legends is the second fighting game based on the Deadliest Warrior show. Play as nine characters including Alexander the Great, Genghis Khan, Sun Tzu, William Wallace, and Hernan Cortes. Characters can unlock different short, mid, and long range weapons and armor to use in battle. Gain an advantage in battle by cutting off or crippling opponents arms or legs.

103957.name: Epoch
103957.description:
User Summary
The rules for Epoch include sections for Character Generation, Action Roles, Combat, and more. This should be everything required to play Epoch.

103958.name: Epoch Variant
103958.description:
User Summary
This ruleset is a variation on the core rules for Epoch, altering some the character abilities and traits as well as some of the game mechanics.

103959.name: Card Summaries
103959.description:
User Summary
This series of images is made for printing and having nearby during gameplay so as to provide summary notes and diagrams regarding the topics of Command, Engineering, Maneuvers, Science, Tactical, and other game aspects.

103960.name: Deal or No Deal
103960.description:
User Summary:

Based on the popular TV gameshow, Deal or No Deal lets you play as either the contestant or the banker and also offers a variety of minigames.

One of the most popular telivision shows makes its way to the Wii where you can now participate at home like never before! Play alone or with friends in a variety of different game modes that let you experience a whole new world of Deal or No Deal.

Features

•A fun and cinematic recreation of the television show. Features the voice of Howie Mandel and allows you to play game after game
•Tired of playing random episodes? Want to bring a friend along? Interested in trying your hand as the banker? Custom games are for you. Up to four players can compete and contestants or against them as the banker.
•Use any of your custom created Mii characters in the game! Profiles will be saved to your Mii, so play again and again to unlock each award
•Try your hand at Banker's challenge, Variety Ladder, or Risky Business for a change of pace. Play as series of games to accomplish specific goals - like being a stingy banker or a greedy contestant
•Unlock over 20 awards! Each shows up in the "My Estate" screen where you can view them anytime.

103961.name: Tiffany Star (Issue 28)
rpgpublisher: History of the Imperium Working Group
103961.description:
From the credits:

Tiffany Star is a monthly amateur periodical published in support of the History of the Imperium Working Group (HIWG).

103962.name: Tiffany Star (Issue 29)
rpgissuearticle: DGP Puts MT Production on Hold
rpgpublisher: History of the Imperium Working Group
103962.description:
From the credits:

Tiffany Star is a monthly amateur periodical published in support of the History of the Imperium Working Group (HIWG).

103963.name: Tiffany Star (Issue 30)
rpgpublisher: History of the Imperium Working Group
103963.description:
User summary:

Tiffany Star is an occasional mass letter sent out to key people in the History of the Imperium Working Group (HIWG).

103964.name: Tiffany Star (Issue 31)
rpgpublisher: History of the Imperium Working Group
103964.description:
User summary:

Tiffany Star is an occasional mass letter sent out to key people in the History of the Imperium Working Group (HIWG).

103965.name: Tiffany Star (Issue 32)
rpgpublisher: History of the Imperium Working Group
103965.description:
User summary:

Tiffany Star is an occasional mass letter sent out to key people in the History of the Imperium Working Group (HIWG).

103967.name: AAB Proceedings (Issue 12)
rpgpublisher: History of the Imperium Working Group
103967.description:
From the masthead:

The Quadrant One Newsletter. Part of the History of the Imperium Working Group family of documents, fanzines, and newsletters.

From the Publication Information:

AAB Proceedings is produced and distributed by Clayton R. Bush, HIWG's Quadrant 1 Editor. It is distributed free to all active analysts in that region.

103968.name: 1942, The Pacific Air War
103968.description:
1942: The Pacific Air War was a DOS-based combat flight simulation released by MicroProse in 1994. It followed the U.S. and Japanese World War II conflict from 1942 to 1945.

This simulation featured aerial combat, ground attack, and naval engagements in the Pacific Theater of Operations. The popularity of this game influenced the creation of European Air War, a sequel.

1942: Pacific Air War could be played as a flight simulator or a wargame. A player could fight a single battle in mission mode or follow the war in tour of duty mode.

In tour of duty mode, a player managed his fleets and air bases on a strategic campaign map. When aircraft engaged in battle, the player could choose to "jump" into the cockpit of any aircraft in the battle.

The game also featured a fairly advanced recording and editing tool allowing the player to edit the film of a mission after it was completed. The player could use any number of cameras and place them anywhere in the scene. One could also scrub the timeline back and forth and make edits. This often overlooked tool was a very popular feature and allowed users to share combat sequences with other players using a special movie format.

Source: Wikipedia, "1942: The Pacific Air War", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Back of Box

...They Were Desperate, Daring And Deadly!

For the past 50 years, only the courageous veteran pilots of World War II knew the real risks of fighting the legendary Pacific air wars.

Now it's your turn!

Strap yourself into the cockpits of 1942, The Pacific Air War and you'll experience the ultimate simulation of daring air combat over the South Pacific. Taking on the same challenges faced by WWII aviators, you'll tangle with the enemy in some of the most heroic battles ever fought. You'll chase down Wildcats, Corsairs, and Zeros through relentless gunfire. You'll pick apart enemy forces by dropping torpedoes. And you'll perform gravity-twisting dive-bomb attacks that will leave you glued to the back of your cockpit!

The outcome of each engagement turns upon your actions. Your task force is depending on you. It's a battle between the devil and the deep blue sea in 1942, The Pacific Air War!


Fly for either the U.S. or Japanese Navy. Choose from ten historically-accurate aircraft, each with authentic cockpit and flight characteristics!



Whose side are you on? Decide for yourself by taking full command of either U.S. or Japanese forces!



Sharpen your skills with varying difficulty options!



To be where the action is, hop into the cockpit of any one of the planes in your flight.



Heart-stopping bomb runs will push your skills and your courage to the absolute brink!



Experience the same field of view as the actual aircraft pilots with an innovative new virtual cockpit!

103970.name: Tobe's Vertical Adventure
103970.description:
Tobe's Vertical Adventure is about Tobe, the overly devoted gamer who's been force on a treasure hunt by his materialistic crush, Nana. The big head duo will travel back and forth in the crumbling caves in search of treasures while rescuing fluffy animals, making you scream kawaii ne~ along the way. With 2 unique characters and a total of 4 islands and 16 levels to explore, the game will last you for hours.

GAME'S FEATURE

Hours of classic platforming action through 4 islands of 16 levels
Play as Tobe or Nana, each with a unique storyline and move sets
Co-op Mode with a friend, as both Tobe and Nana
16 bit graphical retro goodness
Experince the story through cutscenes and unlock the collectable soundtracks and artbook

Source: The Game Website.

103971.name: RIVER UP!
103971.description:
Once a year, salmon undertake an epic journey, leaving the sea and going up rivers to reach their spawning grounds. Throughout this journey, the salmon are not fed, and struggle to make headway against the strong flow river and survive natural predators, as well as fishing gear man. Only stronger survive, thus becomes the natural selection of species and genes are transmitted from the best individuals.

In this game, each player manages a group of 5 salmon, its aim is to cross a river card deck using a deck of cards numbered from 1 to 45. The choice of cards is secretly and simultaneously, by order of the value of the cards, players choose which cards remain in the river, trying to accumulate miles and to avoid bears and fishermen. But playing big cards can cause fatigue, and the player playing the highest card must take the lowest. In addition, a positive score high cards at the end of the game, if held in hand. Finally, the only way to draw cards without waiting to drain your hand, issacrificing a salmon ....

_______________

Una vez al año, los salmones emprenden un épico viaje, abandonando el mar y remontando caudalosos ríos hasta llegar a sus territorios de desove. A lo largo de dicho reco-rrido, los salmones no se alimentan, y luchan por avanzar contra la fuerte corriente y sobrevivir a los depredadores naturales, así como a las artes pesqueras del hombre. Sólo los más fuertes consiguen llegar; de este modo, se hace la selección natural de la especie y se transmiten los genes de los mejores individuos.

En este juego, cada jugador maneja un grupo de 5 salmones; su objetivo es recorrer un mazo de cartas de rio, usando una mano de cartas de impulso numeradas del 1 al 45. La elección de cartas es secreta y simultánea, y por orden del valor de las cartas, los jugadores escogen qué cartas de río se quedan, tratando de acumular kilómetros y evitar osos y pescadores. Pero jugar cartas altas provoca fatiga, y el jugador que juega la carta más alta es penalizado robando la más baja. Además, las cartas altas puntúan positivamente al final del juego, si se conservan en mano. Por último, la única forma de robar cartas sin tener que esperar a agotar la mano, es sacrificar un salmon....

103972.name: MindJack
103972.description:
MindJack is a third-person shooter video game developed by feelplus and published by Square Enix for PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360. In the campaign story, the game is single-player but “transitions seamlessly” into cooperative gameplay. The game was to be originally released in October 2010 for Europe and North America but it was pushed back to Q1 2011. North America took the first release of the turn of the year, followed by Europe and Japan.
MindJack takes place in 2031, when the world’s governments are in decline and new corrupt organizations are arising. The player can “hack” into and control enemies, vehicles, or civilians.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mindjack", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

103973.name: iSlash
103973.description:
iSlash is an addictive slashing puzzle where your finger is your weapon. Swipe to slash your way through challenging levels. Keep an eye on the ninja stars; some are fast, some are ghosts but all are deadly.

Source: The Developer Website.

103974.name: Raiding Company
103974.description:
User Summary

Join Mr. Stogie's Raiding Company and its band of armed archeologists. Join up to four friends locally on the iPad (two player on iPhone) and work to survive wave after wave of monsters while the treasures pile up.

103975.description:
As legendary warlords meeting in the fabled arena of Ortus to decide who is superior, both players command a band of handpicked warriors, all schooled in one of the prime elements. The Ortus arena is believed to be the origin of all things, the place where the prime elements were fed with the raw energies to shape the world as we know it. How true this is can be debated, but this is the only place where energy still flows freely in its purest form. Players must harvest these energies and channel them to their warriors as fast and unpredictable Wind warriors, clever positioning of supporting Fire warriors, and devastating blows from lethal Water warriors will all be necessary to claim victory.

Ortus takes place on a hexagonal board, with each player starting with eight warriors (two of each element) on the back row (the "Haven") in an order of their choice. Ortus is played in rounds, which each consist of four stages:


Collect energy: Each warrior on an energy well generates energy, which flows into the player's general pool.
Maneuver warriors: Players can spend 1 energy per hex to move warriors to better locations or attack opposing warriors.
Return the fallen: When the active player returns his fallen warriors to his Haven, his turn ends.
Defend: Energy remaining from the maneuver phase can be used to defend warriors against incoming attacks; more specifically, each attack has a certain power, and if the defender is unable or unwilling to pay energy equal to this power, the warrior falls.


When a player occupies five energy wells at the start of his turn or has removed all eight opposing warriors, he wins.

Ortus has a gentle learning curve, starting with the Basic game, which can be taught in around eight minutes. From there, players can introduce the special rules for each of the elemental warriors one at a time to learn the full Advanced game. Each warrior has two unique skills that differentiate it from the others. Being able to move all of your warriors on the board gives an enormous amount of tactical options. The excitement of the game lies in the careful planning of your attacks, knowing when to advance and when to withhold Energy as well as knowing whether to save or sacrifice your warriors.
103975.name: Ortus
boardgameexpansion: Ortus Tactica
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 60 - Does Your Heart Go Boom?
HLG-EXTRA 1: Zuiderspel 2016
The Board Game Interview Room: Ortus Kickstarter with Joost Das
The Game Pit: Episode 14.4 - Essen Spiel 2013 Special

103977.name: Peter Packer
103977.description:
Peter Packer Packed a Package...

Help Peter on the production line by throwing the boxes into the correct holes. Grab two or more boxes at once to score combos and rack up that high score. With fast paced, addicting gameplay spread out over three different game modes, Peter Packer is an arcade flick-fest you won’t want to miss!

Source: The Publisher Website.

103979.name: Criminals and Detectives
103979.description:
There is Estonian map on the game board with 10 cities and 2 crime-scenes per city.
The cards have city on the upper part of the card and evidence on bottom part of the card.

Player move around board and make actions according to their character.
If criminal plays a card with the city he stands, he makes a crime to this city and draws one face-down evidence tile (footprint, fingerprint, dna, witness) to avaialable crime-scene of that city. Detective may visit that crime-scene and may turn the tile face-up by playing a card with that city. If criminal has 3 or more face-up evidences, detective may catch him and improson by playing 3 cards matching with the evidences of that criminal.

Objective for criminals is to make 8 crimes to win.
Objective for detectives is to investigate crime-scenes, gather enough evidences and catch all criminals to win.
With combinations players may remove or add evidence-tiles to crime-scenes.

Both character-types may deal and exchange cards with their partners.

Contents:

game board
8 character cards
55 action cards
32 evidence tiles
32 crime tokens in 4 colors
4 criminals in 4 colors
4 detectives in 4 colors

103980.name: Backstab
103980.description:
“My name is Henry Blake, once a proud officer in England’s Royal Navy. Now I stand a shattered man. Betrayed, imprisoned, my fiancée taken away, I have now found my freedom - and soon I shall find my revenge.”

Take on the role of Henry Blake and help in his quest for justice and revenge. Climb, jump and sneak your way through diverse settings to reach your target and strike down adversaries. Use your deadly fighting skills to defeat your nemesis and anyone else who gets in your way. Roam freely across a huge island and gaze upon its magnificent full-3D environments.

-Become a rogue killer with nothing left to live for but vengeance on those who betrayed him.
-Use agility, strength & cunning to get the drop on your target, eliminate them quickly and escape.
-Master the combo-based combat system to slay anyone standing between you and your prey.
-Experience an immersive world with impressive character interactions and lifelike voice effects.
-Roam across a vast island full of exotic 3D environments like jungles, beaches, a volcano and more.
-Investigate 4 unique cities to find new quests and secrets.

Source: The Game Website.

103981.name: 9mm
103981.description:
John "Loose" Kannon is the leader of a special team of hardened cops that aren't afraid to bend the law to clean up the streets. But when they kill a local drug lord's brother and steal millions in cash, Kannon's whole team becomes a target of revenge. Now Kannon has only one option: Take down the gang leader that's hunting them, legally or not, before his team gets taken out first.

-Dive headlong into stylish gunfights where you’ll jump, shoot and fire clip after clip in stunning slow motion stunts to take out rooms full of criminals.
-Catch gang leaders and informants alive, chasing them through the city streets and taking them aside for a not-so-friendly chat in the interrogation challenge.
-Go online to join friends and other opponents in Free for All and Team Deathmatch gunfights for up to 12 players on 4 different maps.
-Become engrossed in the dark story of gang wars, crooked cops and betrayal that will take you through 12 levels and lead you from the dankest slums all the way to Mexico.
-Arm yourself with an arsenal of weapons, including a pistol, shotgun, submachine gun, grenade launcher and more.
-A hip-hop/rap soundtrack that intensifies the tone of the game, including established artists such as: Apathy, Beanie Sigel & Freeway & Jake One.

Source: The Game Website.

103982.name: Little Fears 10th Anniversary Edition
103982.description:
From publisher blurb:

HAPPY BIRTHDAY, LITTLE FEARS!

Remember when you were young and you were afraid of all those things that went bump in the night?

Ever wonder where they went?

Well, wonder no more because the old monsters are back!

Featuring the classic rules and setting of the original game, this tenth anniversary edition includes alternate mechanics, author commentary, all-new artwork, and the original online-only supplements—in print for the first time ever!

This book is a standalone game is not compatible with Little Fears Nightmare Edition or its supplements.

103983.name: Diversion
103983.description:
The game is played on an 18 by 24 square board on which are a pair of home bases for each player, one on each of the short sides of the board. Six barriers are placed in predetermined positions on the board. Each player has two playing pieces and places them off the board next to his bases. He has 3 sets of tiles each set consisting of five tiles, one each of lenght 2 to 6 but only has access to one set at the start of the game.
On the first turn each player in turn places one of his tiles orthogonally such that it covers his home base and no other home base, and moves his playing piece onto the far end of that tile. On subsequent turns a player may start building from his other base or continue from where he has got to by playing a tile that must link up by overlapping at least one square side with his existing tiles. The connected playing piece is moved to the free end of this tile. However, each tile played MUST be longer than the last played tile and players must play if they can legally do so. Each time a player is forced to pass, the next player gets a free move which consists of one of:
Move a barrier, move his playing piece onto or along another player's track or lay any length tile he chooses. As soon as one player runs out of tiles, all players take their next set.
The first player to bring his two playing pieces to orthoganally adjacent squares is the winner but if one player runs out of tiles then the player with his playing pieces the closest together wins.

103984.name: Super Robin Hood
103984.description:
User Summary:

You play the role of Robin Hood, and your goal is to blast the onslaughting fighters and rescue Maid Marion from the clutches of the Sheriff of Nottingham. You will have to cross Sherwood Forest, enter the castle and progress through an array of traps, spiders and other critters. Watch out for your energy level!

103985.name: Ecran (Warhammer le Jeu de Rôle Fantastique)
103985.description:
User Summary:

Jeux Descartes (the French publisher of the first edition of Warhammer FRP) published their own gamemaster screen for the game. The packaging included only the screen and no extra material. The players' side was illustrated with the covers of Empire in Flames, Warhammer City, Something Rotten in Kislev and The Restless Dead.

103986.name: Pour la Gloire d'Ulric
103986.description:
User Summary:

"Pour la Gloire d'Ulric" is the beginning of a French campaign for Warhammer FRP (called "l'Architecte des destinées"). Two more volumes were planned but never released.

The campaign takes place two years after the end of Empire in Flames. The book itself is split in three parts. The first describes the Empire after the civil war and the crowning of the new emperor. The second part is the scenario, in which the players' characters are hired in Middenheim to escort an expedition to Norsca. The goal of the expedition is to strengthen the ties between the Empire and the Norse kingdoms, but of course Chaos cults and saboteurs want to see it fail. The last part includes rules for sailing and sea combat.

103987.name: Vampire Kingdoms, New Revised Edition
rpgissuearticle: Experience Tables – Official source material for Rifts Black Market Sourcebook and Vampire Kingdoms
103987.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kevin Siembieda has completely rewritten, reorganized, and expanded one of the most popular Rifts World Books ever published: World Book 01: Vampire Kingdoms. Updated to 109 P.A., there is so much new material and even original material has been rewritten, that it is practically a brand new book. Yet it also preserves most of the original characters, concepts and information. The new material is built upon the original text, only it has been rewritten, clarified and expanded almost completely and in a much more dramatic fashion than Kevin’s work in [Rifts Sourcebook One] a few years ago. Best of all, it will be quickly followed by the Rifts Vampires Sourcebook.

The Vampire Hunter O.C.C., all new.
Vampires: Their strengths, weaknesses and powers.
Vampire strategies and plans for conquest.
Vampire minions and protectors.
The Hero Vampire and Deluded Vampire O.C.C.s.
The Vampire Kingdoms expanded.
Travel through the Vampire Kingdoms and surrounding areas.
The observations of Doc Reid.
The presence of Archie Three.
Ciudad Juarez mapped and described. A typical village and other places also described.
Updated and revised to 109 P.A., plus Archie Three and more.

103988.name: Heroica: Promo Cards
boardgameexpansion: Heroica: Draida
Heroica: Fortaan
Heroica: Ilrion
Heroica: Nathuz
Heroica: Waldurk
103988.description:
A set of 14 HEROICA promo cards. The cards include all the good characters (Barbarian, Wizard, Ranger, Druid, Rogue and Knight) and all 8 monsters (Goblin King, Goblin Guardian, Goblin Warrior, Dark Duid, Werefolf, Goblin General, Golem Guardian and Golem Lord).

The cards can be used to create random groups of characters or random monster and/or scenarios.

The cards will be freely avalable at HEROICA events in September and October 2011 in Italy.

The full list of events with special promo cards will be published in the news section of LEGO Games Italia web site and on LEGO Gams Italia Facebook Page

103989.name: Operation Gunship
103989.description:
User Summary:

You fly a rescue helicopter and your goal is to search for, rescue and return to safety all eight members of an assault team stranded on an enemy island. Blow enemy tanks and buildings to Kingdom Come and move on to your next mission with yet more members to locate and rescue.

rpgitemversion: Editions de la Lune Sang version
103990.name: Alienoïds
103990.description:
User Summary:

The world of Alienoïds is the same we live in, with a small difference: aliens have been on earth since 1938, plotting, infiltrating governments and preparing for their final goal, a planetary armageddon which will allow them to harvest the entire population of the planet and fill the freezers of their living mothership with tasty carbon-based lifeforms.

The players' characters are alienoïds, extraterrestrial infiltrators tasked with protecting the alien master plan against the human resistance and other alien species. They'll have to adapt to and understand human culture and technology (which don't make any sense to a galactic predator using biomechanical technology), and manage the complexities of human emotions (the longer they are exposed to humans, the harder it is for their empathic brains to avoid being tainted by feelings and heretical thoughts like compassion or fear).

The game system uses several d6: actions are resolved by rolling a number of dice equal to the sum of a stat and a skill, each result of 5 or 6 is a success. The number of successes allows the gamemaster to quantify the result. There are also rules for playing diceless.

The book includes the rules system, a detailed chronology of the world since 1938 (the year of the alienoïds' first contact with earth authorities), details about the alien master plan and those who oppose it, a huge list of biomechanic gear (from weapons like blasters and flamethrowers - which need to be fed regularly and fart a lot, to spaceships and backpacks), and a seven scenarios campaign, starting with the characters' first assignment on earth and ending with the characters, now overwhelmed by human feelings and emotions joining the Resistance and taking the fight to their own specie.

103991.name: Terra Cognita
103991.description:
From The Box of the Game:

Far into the future, on Krion, a remote barren planet orbiting a dying sun, three mining engineers discover the remains of a Warrior Robot, just its head. One curious Engineer kicked the head. It began to speak and told a terrible tale of mankind's destruction of Krion...

...and then the ground beneath began to vibrate, the dust parted, revealing a smooth artificial surface - and they saw that the Warrior Robot head was attached by thick cables to what they were standing on!

Suddenly the head spoke again, this time of revenge...

The Warrior Robot craves vengeance.
- Force Beams seek to destroy you
- Droids pursue you
However, you have your Photon Laser and your reactions are fast.
- Your intelligence is high
- You CAN survive!

103992.name: Naval Battle of Hakodate Bay
103992.description:
This is small sized naval battle wargame based on Boshin war.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Miyako_Bay
Players control one to five ships belong Tokugawa shogunate navy or newly formed Imperial Japanese Navy.

Main actions in game resolve by chit-pull order. Each side has four action chits for movement, fire starboard, fire port and rally.　And initiative players can hold some randomly selected chits to use any timing.

Victory decide by various scenario special rule.

103993.name: The Wormwood Mutiny
103993.description:
From the back of the book:

Pirates take whatever they please, whether it be ships, plunder, or people! The adventurers wake to find themselves press-ganged into the crew of the pirate ship Wormwood, the vessel of the nefarious Captain Barnabus Harrigan. They’ll have to learn how to survive as pirates if they’re to have any hope of weathering rough waves, brutal crew members, enemy pirates, ravenous beasts, and worse. But when fortune turns to their favor, it’s up to the new crew to decide whether they’ll remain the pirate’s swabs or seize control and set sail for adventures all their own.

This volume of Pathfinder Adventure Path launches the Skull & Shackles Adventure Path and includes:


“The Wormwood Mutiny,” a Pathfinder RPG adventure for 1st-level characters, by Richard Pett.
Details of life aboard a pirate vessel and rules for becoming the most infamous scallywag to sail the seas, by Jesse Benner, Richard Pett, and F. Wesley Schneider.
Revelations on the daring faith of Besmara, goddess of pirates, strife, and sea monsters, by Sean K Reynolds.
Death and plunder in the Pathfinder’s Journal, by Robin D. Laws.
Four new monsters, by Jesse Benner, Sean K Reynolds, and Steven D. Russell.

103994.name: Raiders of the Fever Sea
103994.description:
From the back of the book:

Bound for adventure upon the pirate vessel they’ve taken as their own, the heroes face a sea of dangers as they chart a course to become true Free Captains of the Shackles. But life as a pirate doesn’t prove any easier now that they’re in command, as deadly sea monsters, the corpses of drowned scallywags, and raiders from the deep rise to oppose them. When a most unusual map falls into the adventurers’ hands, they have the chance to change their fate in a single daring raid. Is it the heroes’ destiny to be the next victims of the merciless waves, or will fortune smile upon them and spur their rise as the newest and most infamous pirates of the Shackles?

This volume of Pathfinder Adventure Path includes:

Raiders of the Fever Sea, a Pathfinder RPG adventure for 4th-level characters, by Greg A. Vaughan.
A gazetteer of Golarion’s many oceans and seas, and an exploration of the various aquatic races that inhabit them, by Adam Daigle, with Patrick Renie, F. Wesley Schneider, and James L. Sutter.
A journey to Butcher’s Rock and deadly cyclopean prophecies in the Pathfinder’s Journal, by Robin D. Laws.
Six new monsters, by Jesse Benner, Mark Moreland, Steven D. Russell, and Greg A. Vaughan.

103995.name: Tempest Rising
103995.description:
From the back of the book:

The time has come for the heroes to take their places as true pirate lords. But doing so will require more than a ship, a scallywag crew, and a hold full of plunder—they’ll need to win the esteem of the Hurricane King himself. If they succeed, they’ll earn the right to claim even greater glory by participating in the Free Captains’ Regatta, a grueling race along the fringes of the mighty hurricane called the Eye of Abendego. The winners receive a fat prize purse, their own private island, and a seat on the Pirate Council of the Shackles. Will the adventurers triumph against fierce competitors, old rivals, and the treacherous winds and currents of the Eye? Or will their ship be claimed by the storm, a doom that’s befallen so many before them?

This volume of Pathfinder Adventure Path includes:

Tempest Rising, a Pathfinder RPG adventure for 7th-level characters, by Matthew Goodall.
Details on the infamous pirate lords of the Shackles and new rules for storms at sea, by Tork Shaw.
A gazetteer of the infamous pirate city of Port Peril, by Liz Courts.
Ghosts and cyclopes in the Pathfinder’s Journal, by Robin D. Laws.
Five new monsters, by Jesse Benner, Ryan Costello, Philip Minchin, and Tork Shaw.

103996.name: Island of Empty Eyes
103996.description:
From the back of the book:

Having won the Free Captains’ Regatta, the adventurers must now claim their prize—the uninhabited Island of Empty Eyes. Yet exploring strange ruins and fighting the isle’s monstrous denizens won’t be enough. Once they’ve got things well in hand, the adventurers must host a feast for the Shackles' infamous Pirate Council, only to have a dangerous situation turn even worse when a mysterious saboteur threatens to disrupt the party. Can the adventurers tame their island and protect their influential guests? Or will they lose the respect of the pirate lords and fade into obscurity?
This volume of Pathfinder Adventure Path includes:


"Island of Empty Eyes," a Pathfinder RPG adventure for 9th-level characters, by Neil Spicer.
Pirate legends and mysteries of the Shackles, by Jack Graham.
Details on the cyclopes who once ruled the Shackles, by Gareth Hanrahan.
Island harpies in the Pathfinder’s Journal, by Robin D. Laws.
Five new monsters, by Alex Greenshields, Michael Kenway, Mark Moreland, and Tork Shaw.

103997.name: The Price of Infamy
103997.description:
From the publisher's website:

The adventurers now have their own island and port, but they’ll need more than one ship to defend it. They must scour the harbors and docks of the Shackles to recruit more ships and more crews to their flag. But when a rival from their past sends a fleet to attack them, they must defend their island home. And when they sail to his island to get their revenge, the adventurers discover a traitor whose betrayal threatens all of the islands of the Shackles.

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for 11th-level characters, this volume continues the Skull & Shackles Adventure Path. This volume of Pathfinder Adventure Path also delves into the secrets of the deadly cult of Norgorber, god of thieves and assassins, along with presenting new rules for battles between whole pirate fleets. New monsters from the depths of the sea and exotic islands also fill the Pathfinder Bestiary, while Robin D. Laws (author of the Pathfinder Tales novel The Worldwound Gambit) continues his tale of pirates and lost treasures in the Pathfinder’s Journal.

Each monthly full-color softcover Pathfinder Adventure Path volume contains an in-depth adventure scenario, stats for several new monsters, and support articles meant to give Game Masters additional material to expand their campaign. Pathfinder Adventure Path volumes use the Open Game License and work with both the Pathfinder RPG and the world’s oldest fantasy RPG.

103998.name: From Hell's Heart
103998.description:
From the back of the book:

With an enemy fleet intent on conquering the Shackles looming on the horizon, the adventurers must launch their own fleet of pirates and buccaneers to defend against the invaders, culminating in an epic naval battle at the edge of the Eye of Abendego. Will the adventurers defeat the invading navy and save the Shackles? Or will the independence of the Free Captains be eradicated forever?

This volume of Pathfinder Adventure Path includes:

From Hell’s Heart, a Pathfinder RPG adventure for 13th-level characters, by Jason Nelson.
Pirate plots and sinister situations to expand the horizon of your Skull & Shackles campaign, by Adam Daigle.
More menacing sea monsters and terrors from the deep plaguing the Shackles, by Adam Daigle.
A pirate showdown in the Pathfinder’s Journal, by Robin D. Laws.
Seven new monsters, by Adam Daigle, Amanda Hamon, Mark Moreland, Eric Morton, and William Thrasher.

103999.name: Distant Worlds
103999.description:
From the publisher's website:

This 64-page softcover explores the solar system of the Pathfinder campaign setting. Along with extensive gazetteers and maps of each of the numerous planets of this system (including the war-torn Red Planet of Akiton, the undead world of Eox, the primeval Green Planet of Castrovel, gas giants, asteroids, moons, and more), this book includes guidelines for traveling from world to world and exploring the dark depths of outer space. Rules for several new monsters, alien races, and magic round out the otherworldly offerings.

104000.name: Isles of the Shackles
104000.description:
From the publisher's website:

This 64-page book explores one of the Inner Sea region's most notorious realms—the pirate isles known as the Shackles. Here, pirates from throughout the region congregate, yet not all of the Shackles isles are civilized, even by buccaneers and freebooters. Some hold ancient cyclopean ruins and lost treasures, while others are infested with horrific monsters and savage beasts. Isles of the Shackles explores these islands, providing dozens of interesting and exciting sites for adventures and makes a perfect companion volume for GMs seeking to expand their experience running the “Skull & Shackles” adventure path. A large bestiary containing numerous beasts and filthy pirate villains completes this invaluable addition to any piracy-themed campaign.
